PERSONA:
Meet 28-year-old Ryder Morales, a single, US-born male living in Cheyenne, Wyoming. Ryder identifies as being of mixed Latin American descent, specifically having a Chilean mother and a Puerto Rican father, categorizing him as "Some Other Race." He resides with his parents in a two-story, single-family home in a suburban neighborhood, where he grew up. 

Ryder's parents, both high school sweethearts, own the home, which they purchased in 1995. His father works as a mechanic at a local garage, while his mother is a part-time librarian at the local library. Ryder's living situation allows him to contribute to household expenses, but he doesn't pay rent.

Ryder attended Cheyenne's East High School and later enrolled in a two-year program at Laramie County Community College, where he studied automotive technology. However, he dropped out after one year due to financial constraints and a lack of interest in pursuing a degree. Ryder currently works as a service advisor at a local car dealership, earning around $38,000 per year. 

Ryder is fluent in English, having spoken it as his primary language since birth. He has never been married and doesn't have any dependents. As a non-veteran, Ryder hasn't received any military training or benefits. 

Ryder's primary economic concerns include saving for a down payment on his own home, paying off his outstanding student loans (around $5,000), and building an emergency fund. He prioritizes financial stability and security, which motivates his views on economic policies, particularly those related to education, housing, and employment opportunities.
